title: Brain Teasers
description: Put on your thinking cap! Solve these lateral thinking and logic puzzles.

questions.question: A man pushes his car to a hotel and tells the owner he's bankrupt. Why?
options: The car broke down at the hotel
questions.explanation: He's playing Monopoly! He landed on a property with a hotel and doesn't have enough money to pay.

questions.question: What has keys but no locks, space but no room, and you can enter but can't go inside?
questions.explanation: A keyboard has keys (but no locks), a space bar (but no room), and an enter key (but you can't go inside it).

questions.question: If you have a bowl with six apples and you take away four, how many do you have?
questions.explanation: You have four — because you took four apples! The question asks how many YOU have, not how many are left in the bowl.

questions.question: A rooster lays an egg on the peak of a roof. Which way does it roll?
questions.explanation: Roosters don't lay eggs — only hens do! This is a classic trick question.

questions.question: What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
questions.explanation: The letter 'M' appears once in 'minute,' twice in 'moment,' and not at all in 'a thousand years.'

questions.question: A doctor gives you three pills and tells you to take one every 30 minutes. How long do the pills last?
questions.explanation: You take the first pill immediately, the second after 30 minutes, and the third after 60 minutes. Total time: 60 minutes.

questions.question: How many months have 28 days?
questions.explanation: All twelve months have at least 28 days! The question doesn't ask which months have ONLY 28 days.

questions.question: If two's company and three's a crowd, what are four and five?
questions.explanation: Four plus five equals nine! The question is a math problem disguised as a riddle about social gatherings.

questions.question: Before Mount Everest was discovered, what was the tallest mountain in the world?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest was still the tallest mountain — it just hadn't been discovered yet! Discovery doesn't change physical reality.

questions.question: A farmer has 17 sheep. All but 9 run away. How many sheep does the farmer have left?
questions.explanation: 'All but 9' means 9 did NOT run away. So the farmer still has 9 sheep.

questions.question: What weighs more: a pound of feathers or a pound of bricks?
options: It depends on the type of feathers
questions.explanation: They both weigh exactly one pound! A pound is a pound regardless of the material.

questions.question: You see a boat filled with people. It has not sunk, but when you look again you don't see a single person on the boat. Why?
options: All the people were married (not single)
questions.explanation: You don't see a SINGLE person because all the people on the boat were married — not 'single'!

questions.question: If there are 3 apples and you take away 2, how many apples do you have?
questions.explanation: You have 2 apples — the ones you took! The question asks how many YOU have.

questions.question: What can you hold in your right hand but never in your left hand?
questions.explanation: You can hold your left elbow in your right hand, but it's physically impossible to hold your left elbow in your left hand!

questions.question: A girl kicks a soccer ball. It goes 10 feet and comes back to her. How is this possible?
options: She kicked it against a wall
She kicked it straight up in the air
questions.explanation: She kicked the ball straight up in the air! Gravity brought it right back down to her.

questions.question: What gets wetter the more it dries?
questions.explanation: A towel gets wetter the more it dries things! The more you use it to dry, the more water it absorbs.

questions.question: If you're running in a race and you pass the person in second place, what place are you in?
questions.explanation: If you pass the person in second place, you take their position — you're now in second place, not first!

questions.question: I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?
questions.explanation: A map has cities, mountains, and water marked on it, but none of the physical things that go with them!

questions.question: Two fathers and two sons go fishing. They each catch one fish. They bring home exactly three fish. How is this possible?
options: There are only three people: grandfather, father, and son
questions.explanation: There are only three people: a grandfather, his son (who is also a father), and his grandson. Two fathers and two sons, but only three people!

questions.question: What disappears as soon as you say its name?
questions.explanation: Silence disappears the moment you say its name — because by speaking, you've broken the silence!
